text:
Hi <@U04QVT8FQHY>,
You can use the API to store external navigation data in a Hubdb table and then use that data in a page.

I have noticed that some CTA-buttons (Button style is Link (No Style) ) are having problems in Firefox, they are loaded as images and the images are not loading so there is only the image alt-text visible.

This can be tested by setting Browser Privacy >Enhanced Tracking Protection  to Strict-mode. If Firefox is in Standard mode then the CTA-buttons are working.

So try to test Standard/strict mode in firefox to see if the problem is fixed in Standard mode.

Got it, that's not a bad idea. Thanks, <@U022YD6LGAU>. It looks like the consensus here is that importing an external navigation into HubSpot isn't as much of a challenge as exporting one from HubSpot and using it within another environment. Thanks for the info guys!

Hi everyone, new here and looking for some guidance on developing CMS. Trying to go through the instructions listed here but seem to be getting lost along the way. Anyone available to assist? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-modules>

Hi everyone! New to this Slack group and could really use some help with a recent idea I had to improve the BOF LP for our agency's website

Essentially what I want to do is replicate a similar version of the multi-step form found on the landing page for the 2022 U.S. Consumer Trends Report: <https://offers.HubSpot.com/2022-consumer-trends-report-download>

Additional context: When I look in the source code for this form it says "Generated by the HubSpot Template Builder - template version 1.03" for the "multi-step-offers-form-0" module (if I'm reading that correctly) - see attached screenshot

Would be a real game changer if we could utilize a similar module/template for our own website code to help improve our client onboarding process

Any ideas/thoughts you may have would be super helpful!

Hi <@U0133LK9GP9>, A new issue has emerged where your JavaScript code is only being applied to the first `<a>` element in the container, but there are multiple `<a>` elements waiting to use the function. Is there a solution for this scenario?
